This is one and only HalfEatenPie!  Or Don Park if you’ve ever had a support ticket answered by me!

<h2>YOU GUYS ROCK!</h2>

For those of you guys who don’t know us, Catalyst Host was started by the Magnificent Ryan Arp ( @ryanarp ) and the Spectacular Jarland Donnell ( @jarland ) focused on providing our brand of hosting.  We just want you all to know that we’re more than just another provider, **all of us at Catalyst are active on LowEndTalk  and are customers too!**  In addition to that we’re also Catalyst customers ourselves!  We want the best out of everything we get, and we’ll work hard to make sure you get the best we can give!  

We’d just like to thank our loyal customers for helping us become where we are now!

This is the first time Jarland and Ryan has put me in charge of our promotion offer, and although I can’t really beat the bosses I can definitely do the all-time LET classic.

<h2>Data Backup Policy:</h2>

All data on these plans are backed up weekly in Dallas and stored offsite. Our backups are for emergencies. Your user generated backups are for small issues. We only guarantee access to our offsite backups if we are responsible for data loss. This helps keep our costs reasonable while providing two different layers of backups for your important data.
<h2>About our Dallas Datacenter:</h2>

The network behind our Dallas servers is multi-homed with multiple 10Gbit connections and redundant Juniper routing with HSRP failover. Network and hardware conditions are monitored 24/7/365. Spare hardware is always stocked and available on site. We utilize A+B power for redundancy in case of brownouts, which are rare in Dallas.

<h2>Our Hardware Currently:</h2>
2x Xeon E5-2620
64GB ECC Memory
8x 500GB Enterprise SATA
LSI 9260-8i w/BBU & 512MB Cache

<h2>What Makes Catalyst Host a Special Company?</h2>

I could give you so many reasons, but honestly quoting Jarland is probably the best.  “If you’re not going to do something right, don’t bother doing it.”

Re-iterating what I said above, we seriously made this company for ourselves.  We wanted a service to our quality, and when we realized that what we were doing actually worked we decided that we shouldn’t keep it for ourselves.   We don’t settle for mediocre, we care about our clients, and in reality this isn’t about the money.    

Again, quoting Jarland’s last post…
We are not here to give you the most imaginary resources you can't use for the least dollar signs. We are here to give you the best quality, with what I estimate to be some of the least oversold nodes in our market. You have the peace of mind that you services are in good hands, that your service will operate as expected, and that your data will remain safe.

Thanks guys, and rock on!
